page.title: 03ECOLOGY CONTINUED
page.content: Also in this area there is a canal and a river with several adjoining streams .The wildlife in and around the canal and river include swans,ducks and other wild fowl.There are also fish, similar to those in Hyde Lane lake and amphibians in the drained Grand Union Canal. {VEGETATION As the area is rural many varieties of plants and trees are to be found here.The spinnies and copses mainly consist of deciduous trees although there are some evergreen varieties.The hedges are mainly of hawthorn with a few trees aswell. Nettles,goose grass and cow parsley grow in the ditches either side of the hedges.There are also some wild flowers which are clover,buttercups, daises, wild peas, poppies and dandelions.
